intro: Minuartia quadrivalvis, commonly known as the four-valved sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the early spring. Its leaves are usually succulent and arranged in a rosette pattern, helping it conserve water. The species is native to regions across Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
